title: Registered Nurse Interview
Interview Descriptions: Although the unit nursing manager was very nice the interview was incredibly super short . You could tell she was new to the department and wanted new faces on the floor.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation you’ve encountered?

title: WIC Nutritionist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: In the beginning, we talked about the job position, and then about the salary expectation. After we all agree to continue the interview, we went through the interview questions (behavior questions)
Interview Questions:
1. Why interested in this job
2. Tell me a time you create a positive environment
3. Tell me a time when you had to do a quick response

title: Per Diem Temporary Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Boston, MA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: By phone, with manager, through recommendation - the manager was wonderful and I was delighted to start only to find out those who worked in the clinic had not been informed. Put the cart in front of the horse. After 1 week, not needed and finally received return calls from HR about start up.
Interview Questions: Are you registered? Do you have (specific) training for this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Interview Descriptions: You meet with nursing manager and usually after that you get hired if interview went well. Then you hear back fairly soon whether you got the job. You should hear back from HR.
Interview Questions: Nursing scenarios questions and how I would react?

title: Food Service Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare
Interview Descriptions:
When you go in to interview, it will be to ask you a set of questions and then to show you the job and see if you are still interested in it.   

Do not stress!!!! They practically will hire anybody who completes the interview (& completes their medical work)
Interview Questions: What has been your greatest achievement?

title: Med-Surg Telemetry Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Melrose, MA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Fairly quick Interview / hiring process. Got invited to interview about 2 weeks after applying online. Met with Human Resources then Nursing Manager in the same day. Basic behavioral type interview questions
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a delicate patient.

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: standard HR untied, boilerplate questions were asked abs interviewer was satisfied with standards answers.  Nothing was terribly challenging and nothing ended up catching me off guard. The interview was in a small crowded office full of paperwork and it was exceedingly warm in the room. The employees in the office were friendly and warm, but did not look overly busy with their jobs.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Woburn, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Meet with HR, come back to meet with supervisor and or manager, possibly director, In my situation i was hired to start not even 2 weeks later. it went pretty smoothly and quickly.
Interview Questions: where do you expect to be in 5 years

title: Medical Records File Clerk Interview
Interview Descriptions: I volunteered at Hospice and VNA for a month and then asked about a fulltime position that was openning up. It was a temp positon through the Kelly Agency. It lasted for six months.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Melrose, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick and to the point interview by Supervisor and HR Rep.  The Supervisor was a bit abrupt and rushed and asked mostly questions about showing up to work. Didn't seemed all that interested in my skills.  Later discovered most of any training or competency was all handled by other senior employees. Supv. spent most of the time around the hospital.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and after some phone-tag with Human Resources, scheduled an interview. I met with multiple people during my interview, including supervisors and other technicians, and was given a tour of the department.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take if you were having a problem with a co-worker?

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very formal and basic questions were asked. It was not a tough interview but the questions were more subjective and I do not like subjective questions. I was able to go to the second interview but then they said they would call regarding a third interview. The HR lady was nice and told me what to expect, but I never got a call, two weeks later a letter in the mail indicating that I was not selected
Interview Questions: What is it that makes you outstanding.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MelroseWakefield Healthcare (Melrose, MA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I met with Human Resources and my hiring manager. I was also introduced to the lab staff. Not too scary because it's  a dumpy hospital and I figured it was full of trashy people.
